item.title: Oil Set for Weekly Loss as Reports of US, Iran Deal Progress Weighs on Crude
item.description: Oil prices edged lower in Europe and are on course for a weekly loss as reports of progress in talks between Iran and the U.S. add the possibility of fresh supplies to the market.

item.title: Aluminum Gains on Threat to Chinese Output
item.description: Base metals prices rose in early London trading, and aluminium prices were higher as a drought in China threatened to undermine production.

item.title: Turkey Names Former First Republic Executive as Head of Central Bank
item.description: Hafize Gaye Erkan’s appointment represents a possible return to more-orthodox economic policies.

item.title: FTSE 100 Edges Lower on Caution Before Fed, ECB Decisions Next Week; Croda Slides
item.description: The FTSE 100 edged down in opening trade, with investors cautious in the run up to next week’s key central bank meetings.

item.title: Dollar Stays Weak After High US Jobless Claims, Should Steady at Lower Levels
item.description: The dollar remained weak following sharp falls on Thursday, but UniCredit Research said the currency could steady from here as traders stay cautious ahead of events next week, including decisions by the Fed and the ECB.

item.title: Court Papers Open Rare Window Into Role of Graft in China's Overseas Lending
item.description: A former state bank executive collected millions in kickbacks as he helped pioneer Beijing’s resource-for-infrastructure investment model in the Global South.

item.title: 'The Crowded Room' Review: Viewers' Patience Rewarded
item.description: Tom Holland and Amanda Seyfried shine as suspect and interrogator in an intricate 10-part thriller from Apple TV+.

item.title: China's Inflation Problem? It Has None
item.description: As Western central banks continue to jack up interest rates to douse stubbornly high inflation, China faces a growing risk of the opposite problem—deflation.

item.title: AstraZeneca Enters Pact with Cell Therapy Startup
item.description: AstraZeneca will pay Quell Therapeutics $85 million upfront for it to help develop treatments for autoimmune diseases, and further payments of more than $2 billion for future development and commercial milestones and royalties.

item.title: Eurozone Government Bond Yields Likely Have Peaked
item.description: Further ECB interest-rate rises this year are unlikely to trigger another leg up in long-term eurozone government bond yields, Capital Economics said.

item.title: Trump Indicted in Classified Documents Case
item.description: The former president said he has been summoned to the federal courthouse in Miami over his handling of government documents at Mar-a-Lago.

item.title: Dassault Systems Outlines Midterm Targets; Names New CEO
item.description: Dassault Systemes forecast double-digit revenue growth and earnings of €2.2-€2.4 a share in 2028, as the software company named Pascal Daloz as its new CEO effective the beginning of next year.

item.title: Shadow Men: Inside Wagner, Russia's Secret War Company
item.description: We go deep inside the lethal global expansion of the Russian military company—tracing Wagner’s evolution from a small, guns-for-hire operation into a sprawling network of businesses that has been active on four continents.

item.title: Where You Can Still Find a Work From Home Job
item.description: Employers in the Northeast are sticking with flexible-work arrangements while other parts of the country are in flux.

item.title: Where You Can Still Find a Work From Home Job
item.description: Employers in the Northeast hang on to flexible arrangements while other regions are in flux.

item.title: Shadow Men: Inside Wagner, Russia's Secret War Company
item.description: The Wagner Group began as a small clandestine force but has grown into a global war cartel run by Yevgeny Prigozhin, plundering gold and diamonds while advancing the Kremlin’s interests and becoming the face of the Russian assault in Ukraine.

item.title: Where You Can Still Find a Work-From-Home Job
item.description: Employers in the Northeast are sticking with flexible-work arrangements while other parts of the country are in flux.

item.title: Insurers are pulling back on homeowners' policies in vulnerable areas nationally out of fear of floods, storms and fires made worse by climate change and soaring costs of rebuilding.
item.description: Insurers are pulling back on homeowners’ policies in vulnerable areas nationally out of fear of floods, storms and fires made worse by climate change and soaring costs of rebuilding.

item.title: Carvana shares surged 56% after the online used-car retailer said it expects improving profit metrics in the second quarter as cost-cutting measures take hold.
item.description: Carvana shares surged 56% after the online used-car retailer said it expects improving profit metrics in the second quarter as cost-cutting measures take hold.

item.title: White House Covid-19 czar Ashish Jha will be leaving his post next week, the latest sign that the Biden administration is confident the country is on stronger footing in its fight against the virus.
item.description: White House Covid-19 czar Ashish Jha will be leaving his post next week, the latest sign that the Biden administration is confident the country is on stronger footing in its fight against the virus.
